page.title: 14PICK YOUR OWN
page.content: {Royal Spring Farm Longhope. When everyone had jam for tea there was an enormous demand for plums. Nowadays more people prefer to pick and freeze soft fruit. Royal Spring Farm just outside Longhope grows{strawberries,raspberries,black {and red currants and gooseberries }as well as {plums and apples.}Local tradition says that the farm's name arose when Charles l stopped at the farm to drink from the Spring during the Civil War. The farm,owned by Mr and Mrs J.Rogers ,grows about 5 tons of strawberries,4 tons of raspberries and currants each year.Notices in the local press and outside the farm tell the public when the fruit is ready. Families love to spend a pleasant time picking fruit in summer sunshine in lovely surroundings, saving money for winter treats.
